result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called for status.

  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

to the Court filed by Atty. Alberti requesting clarification regarding conditions of bond set on 7/25.

  **Reviewed by Judge Moroney on 08/08/22--Based upon the GPS being removed, the Defendant is not required to report to WCS.**

LF 8/8--advised parties and WCS by email.

to the Court filed by Atty. Thomas P. Alberti regarding conditions of amended cash bond set on 7/25/22.

  **Reviewed by Judge Moroney on 08/02/22--The Court takes no action. Conditions of bond remain as set at hearing on 7/25.**

CONDITIONS MODIFIED ON 07/25/2022:    Defendant to have NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH VICTIM A or the child shared by Defendant and the victim. Court removes GPS requirement. 
If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  The Defendant is allowed to go to his owned business located at W325S1777 Mickle Rd., Delafield, WI 53018. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  The Defendant can possess alcohol for work purposes only, however may not consume.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

10:30 AM Defendant Jeffrey E Scholz in court with attorney Thomas Paul Alberti.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called to address the motion to modify bond. 
Defense requests modification of conditions to allow Defendant contact with the victim.
Victim is recanting her statement.
State opposes the motion for reasons as stated on the record. 
Court modifies the conditions of bond as listed to No Violent Contact. 
Defense requests electronic monitoring be removed. Court orders electronic monitoring requirements be removed.
Bail/bond hearing on July 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED ON 07/06/2022:    If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A (EXCEPTION: contact with victim A, through Our Family Wizard, for the SOLE purpose of the shared minor child) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within .25 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Defendant to pay costs associated with GPS. The Defendant is allowed to go to his owned business located at W325S1777 Mickle Rd., Delafield, WI 53018. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  The Defendant can possess alcohol for work purposes only, however may not consume.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:53 AM Defendant Jeffrey E Scholz in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas Paul Alberti.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Alberti states his client would like to waive his prelim hearing, however did not go over the prelim waiver form.
The Court recesses at 09:54 AM for attorney Alberti to go over the prelim waiver form with his client.
The Court recalls the matter at 10:00 AM with the same appearances.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
